Reviews.Title: “The little things”
Reviews.Author: RperuM
Reviews.Content: I guess I was expecting a bit more. The blankets and towels had some stains. The air con makes a running water noise all night. Thought it was the toilet but I guess it's the pipes somewhere that makes a very loud noise every 20 minutes. The rooms decor is very nice and the staff is really great, but doing this trip again I'd probably check out another spot mostly because I think this one is too expensive for all the things listed above.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: dramaq
Reviews.Content: I too, have to agree with several of the past reviewers that this could be a great place to stay if the management would just fix some minor details. First the pluses of the Cervantes: The location was great. My husband and I were able to walk everywhere in Old San Juan. Although small, the room was quite sufficient for our needs. Very nice decor. Pleasant staff. Now the minuses: The noise from the street behind the building can carry late at night. Two of the three nights we were there we were woken up by some rowdy folks walking home from a neighboring bar. There's nothing the management can do about it, it's just the nature of the location. The lovely shower didn't have a small shelf to put shampoo, soap, etc on while showering. Really inconvenient. The floors were not as clean as I would have expected. I found a quarter and a bottle cap on the carpet from a previous tenant. There was also a small amount of mildew build-up beneath the shower door. I wouldn't have noticed it, but since I had to bend over to pick up my shampoo bottle (due to no shelf in the shower) it was evident that the corners were not cleaned well. Finally, I had an issue with the hotel after check-out. I had wanted to use a different credit card to pay for the stay rather than the one I guaranteed the room with. I gave the clerk the different card, she swiped it and gave me a receipt. When I got home and checked both credit card accounts, both accounts were charged the full fee. She didn't release the hold on the original card and it went through in addition to the charge on the second card. It took a couple of weeks to resolve. I let American Express handle it. Like I said, really mixed feelings about the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JodiDH503
Reviews.Content: The hotel and our Junior Suite Room were beautiful on the surface and it was also a nice location. But there were many issues. Phones in the room didn't work. Light in over the sink in the bathroom didn't work (we tried and tried to make it work, finally figuring out if we slammed the bathroom door it would come on, but only once). The vent in the bathroom was a direct link to the room next door - it was as if our neighbors were in our room with us. The safe in the room didn't work. Needless to say we were disappointed. You might wonder why we didn't go down to the front desk for help (remember our phones didn't work), the young man that checked us told us he'd been there for 2 weeks and seemed to be a bit overwhelmed as it was, we didn't think he'd be able to do anything, we were there only one night so we just lived with the issues. Ultimatly a good hotel stay rests on the details and they were not at the Cervantes Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Travelman-Tx
Reviews.Content: The Cervantes is situated entering old San Juan in a busy street, just accross a parking. Expensive but a a luxury when you are travelling by car. Next to the Cervantes are 5 or more restaurants that attract the cruise people. Which also means that after 10pm they are deserted. Our room was small but since we only stayed one night and never spend a lot of time in the room, it was very OK. Perfect bathroom with plenty hot water. For some reason the restaurant, which is really very stylish with a nice menu, was closed (we had seen it open the week before). It also meant that we could not order extra's to the free breakfast (included when you book via Booking.com) that consisted of 4 slices of toast, two cookies and 2 small cakes (for two people). About outside noise... well there is the noise of the garbage trucks, but I think you just need to understand that this is normal in a city with narrow streets that gets overcrowded during the day with cruise people and needs a thorough cleaning every day. We had room 12 (3d floor) at the back of the hotel overlooking a narrow street. Service at the reception desk and at breakfast was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanvagabond1
Reviews.Content: Its not what it looks like in the pictures, the elevator was not working, the 2nd night we had to leave because they had no electricity. They helped us to look for another hotel, but I had to argue with the so that they would pay for the taxi to move. We had to take all our staff thru stairs, 4th floor, no lights. Without any help. We had to pay for the other hotel. I wouldnt go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: tuzandtum
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The room we booked was the king suite and we did not get any disturbance from the outside noise. Great location for those into the nightlife too. We would stay here again. We stayed here before taking a cruise and the location for the departure day was perfect...like walking distance perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, needs some fine tuning”
Reviews.Author: inchicago1
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location cannot be beat. BE CAREFUL THAT YOU GET THE ROOM YOU BOOKED. I reserved a King Suite which according to the hotel's website had a KING BED, arched colonial doors opening on to Spanish balconies, a separate seating area. There was a picture of this room on the webpage. When I checked in I was put in a room with a double bed, no balcony, a sofa bed in a windowless room and one tiny window to the right of the bed. I went back down to the front desk as this was clearly not the room I had reserved. They told me at first I was in the correct room. They seemed completely confused when I gave them the description of the room as listed on their own website. I was offered a free drink as compensation but declined and asked only to be placed in the room I had booked and was being charged for. Although they were nice the women working the front desk kept insisting that I was in the right room. In fact, one of them stated to me that no rooms in the hotel had a king bed. I then pulled up their own website on my phone to show them what it said. Finally a manager came and offered to switch rooms. The next room was like a different hotel, it was beautiful with high ceilings a KING BED and was the correct type of suite. The staff at the hotel was very friendly but doesn't seem to have basic knowledge of the hotel. Yes this hotel is quite noisy due to street activity but that was expected, just bring earplugs. The bed was very comfortable and the bathrooms were nicely done. The rooms do need some minor fixes. Instead of a tv in the bedroom there was a painting placed in front of the wall mount where a tv used to be (there was one in the other room that worked fine) The bathroom had the fittings for a steam shower but it wasn't working. The rain shower was great! With some minor bug fixes and a better trained staff this hotel would be perfect. It's a beautiful building and the room was decorated well.

Reviews.Title: “Close to resturants and shopping in Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Julia32174
Reviews.Content: Cervantes is right in the heart of Old San Juan, steps away from Crisobal Fort, wonderful resturants (including Panza right down stairs), and all of the jewelry and gift shops. The rooms are somewhat small but beautifully appointed in contemporary style, with a total marble bath. The staff was wonderful, as was the Puerto Rican Coffee each morning - but don't be surprised with a total bread and sweets breakfast, that is very PR. We had a balcony room which was lovely for fresh air, but not so much for the noise. Not a bad stay for a couple of days to see Old San Juan before venturing out to a resort. We got a special through Bookings.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: Doreen S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the best location right in the heart of Old San Juan. It is a beautiful hotel. Like some prior reviews it was noisy. The noise is due to the small alleys between the hotel where every noise is just magnified and echoed. We did have a suite in the rear of the building but was still very noisy. The hotel does need some updating in the rooms. The carpet in our room was in very bad condition, We felt it was way overpriced for the quality of the room. The continental breakfast is very minimal. The great thing about the hotel are the people that work there. Dorcas at the front desk was the sweetest and most helpful. Everyone was very polite and helpful. Believe me no matter which room you are in it will be noisy. Would really not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this hotel. Only positive is location, not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Wendy C
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was less than desirable. The hotel was experiencing water issues during our stay, however, we were never informed of this, and allowed to check-in. The showers were COLD regardless of time of day. The staff should've notified us prior to arriving. Instead we were offered drinks at the bar when we complained. No thanks. Also, our bedding & towels were stained, and the comforter was torn. Not at all what I expected from a boutique hotel with only 12 guestrooms. We booked through Priceline and it was advertised that there was free parking on-site and wifi. I called before arriving to verify where the free parking was, and was told there wasn't any available and to park at the structure across the street. Turns out the hotel considers the greater area of San Juan to be "on-site". Parking ended up costing $60. Wifi never worked, and the staff confirmed that it's spotty. Why bother advertising it then? It has now been a month since our stay, and I am still working with their management to try to resolve the issue. Their staff lacks customer service skills and empathy, which is funny since they are in the hospitality industry. Not at all how I wanted our wonderful vacation in Puerto Rico to end.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Adrianamarie1209
Reviews.Content: Had a horrible experience from arrival to departure. I would never stay here again. The general manager Angel was not very friendly from the moment we stepped in the door, and we received the worst service I've ever experienced. I work for the largest hotel chain, and I recommend for those travelers to stay in chain hotels where you already know what to expect. The hotel ran out of pillows the first night and towels when we only requested one of each. They don't have double beds and they charge $100 for every additional guest. The only good thing about the hotel was the location, I strongly recommend the Sheraton Casino next door. We used their concierge services and they went above and beyond. Don't stay here! Worst nightmare! Waste of money and the rooms are super small.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service & Overall Poor Experience”
Reviews.Author: klf599
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chateau Cervantes on New Year's Eve with my five-person family, after having completed a fantastic cruise to the Southern Caribbean, and as someone who travels frequently, I was astounded by the incredibly poor service, room quality, and overall experience provided by the Cervantes, particularly given the expense. Even though we only stayed for just one night, we experienced an inordinate number of issues (see them listed below), and the response we received from management regarding these issues only became more aloof and unaccommodating with each interaction. 1. Uncomfortable, Unacceptable Sleeping Situation. We were permitted to reserve, and were subsequently placed, in the Penthouse Suite--a double-occupancy room--even though we were a family of five. The hotel frequently loads more than two people into this suite, so they thought this would also be appropriate for our large family, and the sleeping spaces that they presented to us were one king-sized bed, a full-sized sleeper sofa (which my sister and I, both thirty-somethings, had to share) and an airbed on the floor. For an $800 room, the minimum one would expect is a real bed to sleep in, and only two out of the five of us could claim this. 2. Poor Room Design. The Penthouse Suite was clearly designed for couples who want to do nothing else but bathe and/or sleep, since the space allows for no other activities. The TV was in the bedroom but didn't face the bed, and only a few, very uncomfortable ottomans/chairs were set in front of the TV (which, by the way, had intermittent sound a few channels). The only way for five of us to watch TV was through the picture-window in the living room. Ironically, this ended up being somewhat of a blessing, since the bedroom also had a picture-window into the bath/shower area, allowing zero privacy for anyone wishing to bathe (very awkward for families). Lastly, lighting, outlets, and mirrors were clearly the last priorities when designing the space, since they were sparse and placed in ridiculous places. Example: no mirrors by the bathroom sink/vanity. 3. Maintenance Issues. As mentioned in previous reviews, the A/C and hot water are intermittent. A/C worked for us, but was incredibly loud--so loud that the private terrace offered nothing but the sounds of mechanical grumblings and views of a wall of plants (bamboo, I think?) blocking the parking lot across the street. Hot water was also iffy: we had it, but some showers got lukewarm by the end. The key cards stopped functioning in the middle of the night. The wifi only worked in the lobby, not in the room. And the telephones didn't work at all. 4. Poor Hotel Service. We could not check in to our room until after 4:30pm, despite the 3pm check-in. This was particularly unfortunate, since we disembarked from our cruise at 10am. Also, our room was only stocked with four towels (see #1), and despite asking three times, with assurances that they would bring up at least one more towel for our fifth family member, the towels never came. Also, none of the front desk staff was very knowledgeable about nearby restaurants, activities, etc. They would call places we identified but couldn't offer recommendations. 5. Indifferent, Unprofessional Management Response. The manager, Michelle Colon, was incredibly unhelpful. Any one of the aforementioned issues would be enough to issue a complaint, but taken together, they made the price of the room absolutely outrageous, and we sought some sort of response or compensation. During our first phone conversation (made on one of the front-staff's cell phones, about two hours after trying to reach her on the one working telephone in the hotel), we were told that there was absolutely nothing that could be done to make our sleeping situation more comfortable: no additional rooms, mattresses, or airbeds or any other offer, only the one free drink provided to my father during the 90+ minutes we waited for our room. We spoke with Michelle again the following morning, after we overheard her agree to issue a 10% refund to another couple due to their hot water problems. Although she said that she could not offer us the same, since our floor did have hot water, she would speak again to "the owner" to see what she could do. This was a phone conversation in Spanish, which I assume she thought we didn't understand, since she was flippant in her description of our concerns, referred to them as stupid, and highlighted that she had already given us a complimentary drink at the bar (as though this were sufficient). It's unclear whether or not "the owner" actually exists, since Michelle is not permitted to provide this person's direct phone number or email address, but this person(?) did end up giving Michelle authorization to issue us a 5% refund. We took what we could get, but not surprisingly, we did not believe that this was nearly enough. Note: this ended up being an actual refund, rather than a discount, since they put through the full room charge the night before our check-out. The hotel is in a convenient location in Old San Juan, which is an absolutely lovely and interesting place to visit, and I can definitely sympathize with travelers who would prefer to stay in a local, boutique hotel rather than at one of the chain hotels. But, in this case, due to the terrible service and management, the poor design choices prioritizing style over functionality, and the disruptive maintenance issues, I would definitely recommend any other option over this one. And never, ever pay $800+ for the Penthouse Suite, since it will never, ever be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip at great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Dalcrew1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night prior to a cruise and what a great find. The hotel is located in a great area of Old San Juan convenient to everything you might want or need it was 20 dollar ride from the airport and the driver knew exactly where it was. I had read about the recent a/c issues but it was working fine. Check staff was wonderful especially Michele. I would love to come back for a longer stay. BTW never heard any noise from our front facing room.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad...”
Reviews.Author: silvison
Reviews.Content: The Hotel itself is lovely.Rooms are nice but on the small side. Beautiful french doors with balcony.Great location! However there was no hot water the entire time we stayed there, so be warned.They said they would send someone up but never did. So I give the hotel 4 stars for decor, location and a great food. I give 2 stars for service. The staff was great but the management clearly does not make service a priority. To not inform guests prior to their arrival that hot water is not available, is pretty bad. The breakfast is just toast, juice and coffee but the restaurant that opens later is amazing. It is super noisy but it's to be expected and you can't blame the hotel. Just bring plugs and it should be fine. So if you can deal will cold showers then you will be fine. One tip, DO NOT park in the lot closest to the hotel. Across the street there are two lots right next to each other. Park in the second one, the one farther than the first. It's like 9 dollars for 24 hrs vs 50 dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for before/after cruise”
Reviews.Author: MadisonGal6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cervantes the night before our cruise departed from San Juan. The location was perfect â€“ very close to both of the forts in Old San Juan, restaurants, and most anything else youâ€™d want to see in the area. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was clean and more than met our needs. We even had a balcony with a cute view of a quiet street. The continental breakfast was included, but only consisted of bread, muffins, and a pastry, plus coffee and juice â€“ it would have been nice to have fresh fruit, but oh well. The restaurant looked very nice but we opted for something a little less formal elsewhere. Overall it was very pretty, well maintained, and the staff was great. Visited December 2011

Reviews.Title: “Winning people make this worthwhile.”
Reviews.Author: BKBA
Reviews.Content: The staff at this small hotel were as good as it gets. Helpful, friendly just nice people. The hotel is fine, the rooms are nice and the food in the Bar / Resturant was great and shouldn't be missed. My one wish was to have coffee available before 8:30.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: KiaOra97
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on 12/16/2011. I had booked the King's Suite but was given a Junior Suite The front desk manager was pleasant but did not seem overly concerned. The suite was nice and the bathroom was big. The lighting in the suite was very dim, even with every light on. There was construction on the floor above us and both our landing and the elevator were dirty from sand and concrete. Breakfast was served in a very elegant dinning area, but was limited in variety and quantity. The location was great. I have mixed feelings about whether I would go back to the Chateau Cervantes on my next visit or if I could recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for everything!”
Reviews.Author: PeterintheMountains
Reviews.Content: The wife and I stayed here for 4 nights prior to joining a cruise. Unlike some others experience, the taxi driver came straight to the door. The location of the hotel couldn't have been better, right in the middle of things. We stayed in a room on the third floor at the back of the hotel. It was quiet and peacefull and everything worked as it should. In spite of street parties on the Friday and Saturday nights we were not disturbed. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I would have given the hotel 5 stars but the continental breakfast is a bit of a hit or miss affair and not worth hanging around for. Go to one of the many coffee shops instead. All the recommended tourist sites were within easy walking distance although the free trolley passed by the hotel's front door. The San Cristobal fortress was with 5 block and Fort Morro with 12 or 13. The bus station is 4 blocks down the street with the fares being either 50c or 70c. Far cheaper than the taxis which were pretty expensive. One can either tender the exact fare or purchase a travel car at the vending machine in the front of the station. If you have time take the ferry over the bay to visit the Bacardi factory. It's worthwhile and far cheaper than taking an organised tour.

Reviews.Title: “Location is all they have going for them.”
Reviews.Author: Dmj19
Reviews.Content: Despite the location, The hotel managed to disappoint on every level. The original room we reserved was not ready due to a "broken toilet". For some reason it took longer than our planned stay for that to be fixed! The room they eventually put us in was a terrible one on the fifth floor, just in time for the elevator to break. Then the AC was next. The last straw was upon check out. The person at the desk informed us that there was a $25 fee per hour, every hour, after noon, a fee we were not warned about. Shameful all around!

Reviews.Title: “location location location and did i mention friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marshall55
Reviews.Content: The Chateau Cervantes is a gem of a small boutique hotel in the heart of old san juan, close to the intown cruiseship pier (walking distance actually) and many of the best restaurants and touristic sites. The staff is unfailingly helpful and friendly, special mention to michael, and the accommodations are modern, classy and complete. The modern bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. We should mention that our first night at Cervantes, a Sunday, the air conditioner was having technical problems that the staff did it best to alleviate, but real repair was not possible until Monday. So, the first night was a bit uncomfortable in tropical san juan, but glitches do happen even in the best establishments. We are happy to recommend Cervantes to anyone wanting to stay in old san juan for however long. Incidentally we believe the rates are very competitive with anything in the old town.

Reviews.Title: “BRING YOUR OWN AC”
Reviews.Author: RinconPaco
Reviews.Content: I as initally drawn to this botigue hotel because of its european styling and convenient location. Booked in advance and they had my phone #. Check in and go to the room, and hot as HELL, turned AC on and tried to call front desk and no dial tone. Went downstairs to front desk and informed that room phones are not working at all. their phone system is dead for internal call (convenirent?) AND that the AC was not working. But was told by front desk person if you ca n turn the unit on, it most be working in your unit (they had problen with AC). Went out and came back at 8 PM, warm still hot and tried to put us in another room, but that air was not working there also. Thank GOD for the my ipone and priceline.com, got room at Sheraton one block over for cheaper rate. But it deosn't end there, DO NOT come to Cervante if you have a car, the garage they recommended and that I parked in they only have a fixed rate for 10 ten hours? We had left our car due to proximity to Sheraton and were charged $55.00 to park in the garage. The Sheraton would have only charged $21 for valet parking. Shame that general manager or owner did NOT want to inform of no AC in rooms. Passed by hotel next day and all windows wide open to noise in street. glad we left and stayed at Sheraton still.

Reviews.Title: “Cervantes - great hotel, not great location”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl63
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 1 night prior to our cruise. Taxi driver could not locate front door. actually had to wander the street to find the entrance. Could use better signage. Greeted warmly and given a beautiful large room with king bed, 2 bathrooms. AC worked great, was actually a bit cold. As it was late we decided to eat at their restaurant. it was first class! waiter was great and food was wonderful. We were very tired after being up very early to catch our flights. Had read previous reviews about the street noise but very few other hotel rooms were available in old San Juan. The noise on a Friday night was bad. Shutter windows did nothing to keep the noise at bay. Our room faced the street. other rooms on the side or back probably would be quieter. Bed was very comfortable and large bathroom was beautiful. It was too bad about the noise from outside. In the morning we ate the complimentary continental breakfast (way too much bread!) and went walking. Convienent location for sightseeing in Old San Juan. All in all, a nice small hotel. need better signage but otherwise restaurant was great. Room was great. Nothing they can do about the street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Does $177.00 include AC?”
Reviews.Author: eram11
Reviews.Content: I reserved a one night stay following a Carnival cruise. Initially, I had reserved a room at the Milano, but I kept reading bad reviews and cancelled that reservation with a 10% administration fee to do so. I wanted to end my vacation on a high note, so I made a reservation at the Cervantes based on good reviews and its proximity to the Carnival pier. To start with, this place was hard to locate even with GPS. We walked past it probably three times. The only identification on the building is two C's etched in the glass of the doors. Nothing else, just two C's, not even an address. Once we found it, it seemed exactly what I was hoping for. We were shown to our room which was small but decorated nicely. The bathroom was very nice too. As the man was leaving our room, we asked how to turn on the AC because it was very warm in there. He then told us that it wasn't working, but it was being worked on and should be back on before too long. My husband and I exchanged glances because our cruise cabin had problems with AC too. As a result, I had slept terribly the whole time. With two nights left of a seven night cruise, and numerous service calls they finally offered to move us to another cabin. Our room at the hotel was going to be a lot hotter then our cabin! Long story short... by 10:00 PM that evening the AC still wasn't fixed and they did not want to credit us if we moved to another hotel (all of their rooms were without AC). The only thing we used the room for at that point was to store our luggage. I was prepared to sleep on the lobby couch in my p.j.s and tell every guest that came in that the AC was not working (and write a bad review). This was relayed to the owner who said if I wanted to sleep on the couch I could, but asked if I would wait till after the lobby restaurant closed at 11:00!! Wasn't that nice of him/her!! Meanwhile, my husband was emphatic that I was not sleeping on the couch and wanted to just go to another hotel. If we did that, our one night stay in San Juan was going to end up costing us $500.00! I could take another cruise for that price! Eventually, the chef at the restaurant (who was very nice and gracious) ended up calling the owner again, and was able to get the night's stay credited for us. We then moved to the Sheraton about 11:00 at night. My main complaint is that they did not tell us the AC was broken before we checked in, and they should of at least given us the choice to move somewhere else and not be charged. I understand the importance of cancellation policies, but the room was just too hot to sleep in. The most disturbing thing for me is that the owner, who is most likely a millionaire, did not seem to be concerned with his/her customers. This may be a great place to stay when everything is working well, but a better indication of quality of customer service and hospitality is how customers are treated when things are not!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the hotel for our 10 year anniversary. Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were clean and housekeeping always replenished what we needed. There is a new chef and the food was excellent. Our room faced the back and it was mostly noisy in the morning but is expected when staying in a bustling city. If there is one thing we could have changed, we would have liked to have had more bed pillows. Only one each was provided. We would stay again if given the chance to come back to Old San Juan. We miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough!”
Reviews.Author: VMT0708
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Cervantes for two nights on our honeymoon while waiting to board a cruise from Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. It was everything we could have hoped for and more. When we booked the hotel, we were going with a gut feeling and just hoping that it would be nice. It was amazing! It is a beautiful hotel and the room was wonderful. The hotel staff was all very friendly and more than willing to help with anything. The room was incredible. We stayed in room #9 on the 3rd floor which faces the street. We had 3 balconies! The room had a wet bar area, a pull out couch bed, three sitting chairs, and a flat screen TV. In the bedroom area, there was a huge king size bed (very comfortable) and all of the decorations, lighting and extras were all very modern. The bathroom was great with double sinks and a very large steam shower! (however, the steam shower did not work, but they were getting it fixed.). The only other thing is the noise. The street below and the people leaving the restaurants and bars are very loud. The sound continues well into the night and even into the early morning hours. Donâ€™t plan to get too much sleep, but for the price in the off season. Cervantes is gorgeous with a great location and wonderful ambiance. We would recommend this hotel to others that want something different than your average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a Central Location, with Caveats”
Reviews.Author: Meticulous_One
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Chateau Cervantes for nine days and eight nights during a birthday get-away trip to Puerto Rico. The hotel staff was friendly and polite. Chateau Cervantes is situated in Old San Juan, amid excellent restaurants, shopping and night-life. The location of this hotel is excellent for sightseeing and it provides easy access to all of the attractions Old San Juan has to offer. I was accommodated with a petite room on the fourth floor of the hotel, facing a back street. My room was small, with mediocre dÃ©cor. The closet space was minimal. However, my bathroom was truly amazing. I loved the shower. The luxurious bathroom was the best part of my stay at Chateau Cervantes. The Wi-Fi internet connection was not available during my stay at the hotel, which was a major inconvenience and disappointment. The room telephone did not work for the duration of my stay at Chateau Cervantes. Upon inquiry, hotel staff advised me that the telephone service was down hotel wide and that the problem was being addressed. I was not able to call for room service for the length of my stay. Having room service would have been nice during a relaxing get-away trip. I was disappointed with the lack of amenities and services at Chateau Cervantes. Chateau Cervantes does not appear to be a hotel meant for relaxation. The noise level from the adjoining neighborhood is overwhelming day and night. Overall, Chateau Cervantes appeared to be a comfortable hotel conveniently situated for those who enjoy the night-life Old San Juan has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: boricuajetsetter
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied with my stay at Hotel Cervantes. The rooms were a decent size, clean, and nicely decorated. The front desk manager told me that they try to redecorate every year. Our room also had a balcony, with a great view of the colonial streets of Old San Juan. The location is great for Old San Juan, close to all the attractions and also easy to leave if you are by car. I wish there was more variety in the breakfast but while in Puerto Rico, you must take advantage of the bakeries, they have the best breakfast, so it was not a big deal. Important note: Make sure to park at DoÃ±a Fela parking (there are two lots in front of the hotel). The other one is very expensive, the front desk guy did warn us but we were too lazy to move the car! We paid for it the next morning $26, the following night we stayed and it was $5!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Cervantes.”
Reviews.Author: ebat
Reviews.Content: I loved my stayed at Chateau Cervantes. My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights prior to leaving on a cruise. All the hotels in Old San Juan are pretty pricey. We decided on Cervantes when El Convento was booked. I am very happy with my decision. The hotel is very small, only 12 rooms I believe. The rooms themselves are updated and very nice. The bathrooms are good sized. The bed is super comfortable, one of the best hotel beds I've ever slept in. All rooms have either a balcony or large windows that can be opened. Yes, Old San Juan can get a little loud, but we had no problems sleeping at all! There is a restaurant on the first floor that was very good. Granted we only ate there for breakfast but the food was very reasonably priced and good. For hotel guests the continental breakfast is free (includes danishes, rolls, juice, fruit, coffee, etc.) or you can opt to order off the menu. We also had room service one night which leads me to the only bad part about my stay. I had an allergic reaction (I'm allergic to nuts) to one of the dishes. The staff was very helpful in finding us a cab and a hospital. They checked up on me to make sure I was doing okay. The helped to make a bad experience not so bad. Although I was a little frustrated they wouldn't take any of the meal off of our bill considering we ate hardly any of it. The location is amazing. Very close to the cruise ship pier (although there is another pier in San Juan so check which one your ship leaves from). Walking distance from all the sites in OSU. My husband and I walked everyone (except for the brief hospital trip I talked about above). There is a sports bar called the Brick House less than 50 yards down the road if you need your sports fix while on vacation. We watched the NFL games here. The owner of the bar is the bartender and he is awesome. The service and rooms are both wonderful. If you are heading to Old San Juan I highly recommend Chateau Cervantes. I wish I could give 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: marie14ds
Reviews.Content: I couldnt be happier with our stay, short, but awesome. We stayed one night and everything from the front desk staff to the location was awesome. The room was spotless clean and very tastfully decorated. The shower preassure was amazing (which is a big deal in the island I came to realize) The bed was super confi with fluffy pillow and confy sheets. There was a nice balcony overlooking San Juan. They offer continental breakfast. Parking is not included but there are 2 parking garages litterally accross the street. There are pleanty of shops and restaurants withing walking distance and "El Morro" is a 10 minute walk. We will be returning!!!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful small hotel right in the heart of San Juan”
Reviews.Author: entucasa
Reviews.Content: This was a charming place with re modeled rooms and bathrooms. Rooms were a bit small but the atmosphere and fact that it was so central made up for that. The price per night was good and I would stay there again should I be in San Juan. Breakfast was not included, but there was a lovely dining area where you could eat. The staff were most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: KillianMick
Reviews.Content: Angel, the hotel manager, was just amazing. He was generous, accommodating, friendly and really made our stay welcoming. The room was immaculate, I loved the style of the bathroom, along with the toiletries provided. Breakfast in the morning was delicious, and everything was a breeze checking in and out. I really can't say enough about the Cervantes. It's proximity to the port makes it convenient, and the price makes it well worth the effort to find it. (It's smaller, not very visible, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “A GEM”
Reviews.Author: Oaklandingie
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed at the Cervantes and I must say we were EXTREMELY happy with the hotel and it's entire staff. We scheduled our travel plans last minute for a funeral and Angel the GM was very gracious ensuring are needs were met. We want to thank Maria, Michelle, Angel and Angel for all their help. The location is great/safe/lively and the rooms are extremely modern....THANK YOU CERVANTES. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Boutique Hotel in the heart of Old San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: mrsdiana2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here and we loved it. Great atmosphere. Wonderful location. Service was Great. The rooms were cozy and inviting. The attention to customer service was amazing. I will recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to stay in a boutique hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, Charming, Friendly”
Reviews.Author: byco
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan for Memorial day weekend, I made a reservation at the Cervantes hotel at the last minute, I was not sure what to expect. The Cervantes is a gem! great location, friendly, knowledgeable staff beautiful, well appointed rooms and a fabulous restaurant on the premises. When traveling to SJ definitely check out the Cervantes. I will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: DGR2000
Reviews.Content: I spent couple of day at Cervantes hotel after a business trip and I must say that I had a wonderful stay thanks to the staff, hotel spirit and location. Special thanks to Angelica and her co-workers. My room was on the third floor with a balcony behind the main street and it was not noisy at all. I highly recommend this hotel and I will go there next time for sure.

Reviews.Title: “unable to sleep,noisy room”
Reviews.Author: tsconley
Reviews.Content: I requested a quiet room that wasn't very quiet at all. The rooms are small but modern. Flat screen TV with Direct TV. Bathrooms are modern and a full shower. Not much room to walk around and the 2 doors that lead out to the balcony are not well sealed or insulated. We heard everything and everybody walking down the street until 4 am. The location is good if you're not worried about a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: carpentertourist
Reviews.Content: "You can't please all the people all the time...". We like this hotel very much and, we always try and turn off air conditioners and seek natural fresh air. We did this in our room at the Cervantes and slept well. The staff are very friendly and spoke perfect English which made it hard to practice our less-than-perfect Spanish (not a complaint).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: MVLULU
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night only, just prior to a cruise. The location was great for sightseeing in old San Juan as well as shopping and dining. It's a boutique hotel, with modern furnishings. The rooms are not enormous, but spacious enough. Ours had a balcony overlooking the back of the hotel. The bathroom was large and beautifully done. The bed was very comfortable, and the staff was extremely helpful. The only drawback is that due to it's location, it was a bit noisy late at night. That said, we plan to stay here the next time we are in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Location”
Reviews.Author: lonelobo
Reviews.Content: Great location..walking distances to best of old San Juan. Rooms a little tight but fairly modern. Air conditioning went out on our floor on last night of stay...fortunately it was December so not to hot with window open and borrowed fan blowing. Unfortunately it was New Years eve so the sounds were a little harsh stopping about 3 am. For the price a good option in old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and luxurious at once”
Reviews.Author: Beachesinaz
Reviews.Content: You know how sometimes you stay at an upscale hotel and even though it's pretty you kind of feel out of your element and everyone's kind of snooty? Cervantes is nothing like that. It's pretty modern and updated, has a rather luxurious lobby but at the same time, it's cozy. The service lends the cozy feel. Ricardo and Raul will make you feel at home, like you're staying at their house as their guest. Ask them where to go, what to see, what to eat, they'll tell you. They'll even pull up menus for restaurants on the web for you. Go to Raices to eat, a couple doors down. Authentic and out of this world food. Ricardo recommended Cafe la Princesa for dinner... WOW. It was a dimly lit, outdoor cafe nestled amongst large trees and about the most romantic restaurant with the best ceviche you'll ever taste. We stayed in a junior suite, which was a very nice size with a sitting area. The bathroom is small but newly updated and the shower will relax you no matter how tense you are. Everything looks newly updated and modern. The linens are comfy and soft. The bed was a little lumpy but that's the least of your sleep problems. PLEASE NOTE - If you stay anywhere in Old San Juan, it will be noisy on the weekends. At all hours. Bring ear plugs. I've stayed in Old San Juan before. They like to party. Overall, we really liked Cervantes, its location and the service. Stay here if you like superb service, well appointed rooms and a good location. I would definitely stay there the next time I go to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: gmae1
Reviews.Content: This chateau/hotel is beautiful! The service is very attentive, friendly, and accommodating. The rooms have marble tiled bathrooms, totally updated, fine linens, flat screened TV, private balcony, and artfully decorated! We arrived hours before our check-in time and were immediately accommodated with check-in, we were then served coffee & danishes, and taken to our room. Raul is the best! He has much advice on what to do, and where to eat. And he will ensure you have the most memorable and comfortable stay. We felt totally at home at Cervantes and will most definitely return. In addition, El Morro Fort is not too far of a walk. My husband and I walked from Cervantes to El Morro and toured the fort. Later, we had lunch at a Spanish restaurant near El Convento, and finally relaxed in our hotel room before going out for dinner. Cervantes is in a very safe & quaint area and within walking distance to all of Old San Juan. It is right next to a well reviewed, & fine-dining Italian Restaurant and Raices Restaurant, known for their local cuisine. We had dinner at Cervantes' Restaurant and were very impressed with the artful & delicious cuisine. Our waiter, Ricky, was very attentive, and friendly. We enjoyed our stay immensely at Cervantes! We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough”
Reviews.Author: sammer057
Reviews.Content: Cervantes Hotel in Old San Juan is a terrific boutique hotel with a great location. We stayed one night (Floor 4, Room 6) in a suite that contained a very comfortable double bed and an equally comfortable fold out couch for our 23 year old son. The front desk service was top notch. You won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Not understanding prior postings, Cervantes is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: lynxy12
Reviews.Content: Our experience was Great! The service was excellent, gave us great tips on good restaurants around. Also gave us information about tours outside of old san juan which by the way anyone that goes to Puerto Rico should go to Fajardo to the biobay tour it is an unforgetable experience. As issued in other postings, that the A/C wasn't working it is now atleast because we didn't have any problems at all in that aspect. Cervantes room were very modern and appropiately put out. Our experience in Old San JUan was great and from my point of view it was thanks to that little hotel. I definatly recomend it for anyone that wants to have a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare in San Juan, Deserves to go out of business”
Reviews.Author: AustinRunner2009
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property but awful service. We arrived and were told that the air conditioning was not working. We were showed a room which was nicely appointed but very hot. Impossible to imagine staying in such a situation. We were left to our own devices to find some place else to stay. I asked multiple times to speak with the manager or owner and was told that this was not possible. Why didn't they call me before I arrived? I am monitoring my credit card to make sure they don't try to charge me for this. I would put nothing past this place.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, away. Don't take the chance with the abysmal service”
Reviews.Author: TravelDad999
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 28th of December for a two night stay and hit the exact same situation described below. We arrived late in the evening, were told that there was no air conditioning, told that we could have our regular room (which was stifling) at 30 percent off, and then told that the only help they could provide was to call around San Juan and see what availability there was in other hotels. What a freaking nightmare. We had decided to splurge on what seemed to be a very nice hotel and ended up almost ruining the San Juan portion of our vacation. Other postings make it clear that the AC had been out at least two weeks prior to Christmas. They had my phone number but never bothered to call to alert us so that we could make other arrangements. The offer to stay in the hotel without the AC was ridiculous. The room was in the high 80s and completely impossible to relax in. We had to bang on the outside door for several minutes before we were let in. Our booking contract clearly outlined that if we canceled less than three days prior to our stay that we would be charged the full amount. The hotel offer NO compensation, e.g., a discounted rate at another hotel, a complimentary meal or even a taxi ride, and NO apology beyond what the poor beleaguered night clerk could offer. Also, the hotel website (I checked) had NO information about the AC problem. I suspect that management was hoping that they could get some money from a few no shows and whoever was desperate enough to agree to sleep in a sauna. My advice is to stay away from this place. The facility is nice (what I could make out in the dark and heat) but the management is clearly incompetent and does not show any responsibility towards its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Fawlty Towers Service!”
Reviews.Author: CarlGibson
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on Christmas evening to the Cervantes Hotel after travelling for over 20 hours, and were looking forward to staying in the Cervantes Suite â€“ as a Christmas treat, paying over $1000 for two nights, before catching a cruise ship. We were greeted by night security whose only English was; â€œNo room, No AC â€“ We no charge youâ€�, telling our taxi driver not to unpack our bags saying â€œno stay â€“ no stayâ€�. The Hotel Management knew in advance there was a problem with the air conditioning. They did not contact us beforehand, they did not have anyone available who spoke English to explain the situation â€“ and most appallingly had not tried to arrange alterative accommodation. (Many Hotels were full for Christmas - We were left to find our own alternative accomodation at 11.00pm) The hotel claims it was a unique experience and suggest in the future we may wish to try again to sample the award winning quality customer service that characterizes The Cervantes Hotelâ€“ We had the most awful experience and will never stay again and suggest the only award it is likely to win is the â€œFawlty Towers Customer Service Award for really Bad Serviceâ€�

Reviews.Title: “Very Lovely Boutique Hotel With Friendly and Helpful Staff, But Beware the Street Noise at Night”
Reviews.Author: California03
Reviews.Content: The Cervantes, a "Conde Nast" hotel, is located on one of the main arteries into Old San Juan, Puerto Rico. My fiance and I checked into the Cervantes after checking into a beach-area Conde Nast hotel in Isla Verde, Puerto Rico. Once we drove into Old San Juan, we were certain that the beach-and-casino scene of Isla Verde would not hold our interest as much as the charm of the old city. The Cervantes reminded me very much of the inns and small hotels of Florence, Italy. The hotel has only 12 rooms, ranging from small to grand suite. Ours had a balcony, a flat-screen television, and a dvd player. Our room was very clean, neat, stylish, and cozy. The staff at the Cervantes is the BEST I've encountered at any hotel. Everyone was warm, helpful and friendly to the utmost, and the complimentary continental breakfasts were the best complimentary continental breakfasts I've ever had. We're talking fresh, flavorful food here. Great Puerto Rican coffee. And terrific service. No buffet. On two occasions, we had the breakfasts brought to our room. I very much enjoyed staying here. The hotel has rooftop access, an award-winning restaurant, and is within walking distance of shops and attractions. It is not at all in a "tucked-away" corner of Old San Juan. Next door to the hotel is a spa. Across the street is a building that is hosting the Bodies Exhibit this month, and busloads of children visited the exhibit Monday through Friday during our stay at the Cervantes. Next door to the Bodies Exhibit is the public parking garage, which seems to be where just about everyone parks. That place is almost always busy, with cars going in and out. Though I very much liked the Cervantes, my fiance told me that it is the nosiest hotel he's ever stayed in and that he would not return. Prior to checking in, I did warn him that some of the Tripadvisor Reviewers complained about the noise here. He is a light sleeper, and bought ear plugs after his first night there. I don't mind the noise as much. For me, it's all part of experiencing Puerto Rico. It bears clarifying that the noise my fiance heard was the hustle and bustle of Old San Juan; the hotel itself was very quiet. In the morning, starting very early, there was the noise of the construction crew a few doors down from the hotel. At night, there was the noise of very young people partying in the street. Friday night was probably the loudest night because a drummer at a nearby square decided to put on a show at about 3 a.m. For those who want a quieter stay in a charming Old San Juan hotel, check out El Convento.

Reviews.Title: “Very loud, wouldn't let us leave”
Reviews.Author: Floridamb
Reviews.Content: After travelling around Puerto Rico for a week, we (my husband and I, our 5 month old baby, and her grandmothers) booked our last two nights in Puerto Rico at the Cervantes. We all slept horribly due to the noise from the street below. Dogs barking, car alarms, people shouting, garbage trucks beeping ALL NIGHT LONG. We explained the situation to the front desk and asked to be moved to a different room. The response was that we were already placed on the 5th floor and there were no interior rooms available. We went out to find another hotel in the city and when we explained that we would have to check out we were told that they would charge us for the second night of our reservation if we left. The front desk manager said she would have to check with the owner of the hotel to determine if he wanted to charge us for the second night. Their response was "we are not respsible for anything outside of the hotel". At $250 a night per room, we could not afford to be charged for the room AND stay somewhere else. Later that afternoon they sent earplugs to our room. What a terrible stay for all of us as the second night was noisier than the first.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel, but a little loud”
Reviews.Author: OregonRainGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Cervantes before getting on a cruise with Royal Caribbean. We wanted to stay in old town so we could walk around the city before getting on board. The Cervantes seemed reasonably priced. We arrived late at night (after midnight). The staff was very friendly and helpful even at that late hour. The person at the front desk spoke flawless English even though they were native to San Juan. This hotel is on a narrow street and the taxi ride there was interesting, dodging all the traffic that apparently tends to collect on Friday nights. The room was small but very well appointed. You could tell it was remodeled and decorated by an expert. It even had a wide screen HDTV. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom clean and well appointed. The food in the downstairs restaurant was superb. We really liked how close the hotel was to stores (Walgreens) and the water front. We walked around the old city wall and back. The only problem we had wasn't with the hotel at all but with all the people making noise out on the streets. It kept us up most of the night but I don't know how you could avoid that. The next day the front desk person went out on the street to hail us a cab and helped us get our bags in. The room rate was about $240 but with tax and food it was almost $300. All in all I would recommend this hotel highly, but you might bring ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at Cervantes”
Reviews.Author: cjbenz
Reviews.Content: We had a great one stay at Cervantes. Old world charm. Free continental breakfast was delivered to our room very timely. The staff was friendly and attentive. Riding the elevator down in the morning, I asked the other couple (whom we did not know) "how was your room?" They had been there for 2-3 nights and gave us the thumbs up. The one detraction was a barking dog at 4 AM coming from the street below. We would stay there again in a heartbeat. We did not try the restaurant but would have liked to.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully rebuilt hotel in an ild city”
Reviews.Author: verojerry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in old San Juan for two days by choice. I had grown up in Puerto Rico fifty years ago, and remembered old San juan as a crumbling ruin. Yet I was delighted with the hotel and the city. The hotel was charming, the staff attentive and pleasant, the breakfast wonderful. My only regret is that I never had dinner at the restaurant (Panza's). I would definitely recommend it to anyone but the most jaded and disillusioned of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for young professional yuppies”
Reviews.Author: frequentravelerNY_FL
Reviews.Content: We were scheduled to arrive around noon on cxmas day but because of bad weather in the north east coast we end up arriving at midnight. We called to let them know and soon as we got in the staff was perfect, friendly, professional, and understanding. Because it was cxmas night everything in the city was closed early, even the restaurant. Since we were starving after a whole at the airport and plain and we just wanted something to snack on, the staff member went beyond the call of duty and prepare a tray of cheese, fruits, and crackers. That is definetly service. We stay a week in the hotel and it was perfect because it is small boutique hotel in Old San Juan. Two blocks off the hotel you have a few great bars and restaurants. Only a few doors down the hotel you also have a great authentic local cuisine restaurant. Since the hotel is in Old san juan you don't need a car you can just walk the area. Loved the room and bathroom as well as the little balcony. Definetly will reccommend to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss”
Reviews.Author: TwinsburgOzzie
Reviews.Content: We searched for a small quaint hotel near the water. The Cervantes certainly fitted the description. Sometimes searching and choosing a hotel is a shot in the dark but this experience was absolute bliss. Hotel was small just as we liked. The restaurant had a small menu, but GREAT FOOD and a continental breakfast was served daily. My husband, who brought me here for my birthday, and friends from California stayed here from March 3 - March 10. The shops, restaurants, and vendors selling their ware were all close by. The staff Luise, Amy, Nelmary and the front desk staff were friendly, helpful and exceptional beyond belief. We would all stay here again. THE MILLERS, From Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Inspired decor”
Reviews.Author: EasternShoreman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Cervantes for four days and had an excellent experience. The decor in this small boutique hotel is unique. It is the work of an outstanding Puerto Rican designer, and although I don't generally like contemporary style, this motif is done so well that anyone would be impressed. We stayed in a junior suite, which was quite commodious. Our adult children stayed in standard rooms, which were a bit small but very comfortable. Appointments are first-class: marble tiled bath, comfy bed, attractive furniture, flat screen TV. (The standard rooms and junior suites are available only with queen beds.) The restaurant on the first floor was ideal for breakfast--quiet and elegant and with a continental breakfast of many types of fruit and cheese. On two of the days I ordered white egg omelets, which were done with a flair by the chef and added little cost to our bill. The restaurant also has a very attractive bar, which was a perfect spot to relax after our busy days of sightseeing. The staff is very accommodating on day and evening shifts. They speak excellent English and do whatever they can to be of assistance (e.g., using their PC to print out airline passes and copy documents). The reservations manager, Luis Correia, contacted us a couple of times by Email prior to our stay just to confirm that all was in order. The only negative to our experience is that the attractive restored wood doors to each room's balcony are relatively sound porous. As a result, the noise from a construction site across the narrow street was very intrusive from 7:00 on. From what I could see of the building site, the work should be completed within a few months. Overall, Cervantes provided a nice blend of luxury accommodations with value received. The cost is about 20%+ below El Convento, and the experience is far more personal.
